general_advisory: Due to low night temperature and fog condition, there will be chance of infestation of sucking pests, leaf blight, powdery mildew in the Rabi crops and vegetables. Monitor the crops and vegetables, if symptoms are noticed, undertake appropriate plant protection measures. Carry out weeding, hoeing and other intercultural operations in Rabi vegetables. In Cole crops irrigation should be done at 7-8 Days interval depending upon soil moisture and weather condition. In winter during cold hours farmers should keep doors, windows and open spaces in cow sheds covered with polythene or gunny bag curtains to prevent direct contact to cold air. For maintaining the heat in the poultry shed during winter season, install heaters in the shed.

advisory: Arrange good quality paddy seed varieties like Satyabhama, Sahabhagi Dhan, Mandakini, Manaswini, DRR 42, DRR-43, DRR-44, Bina 11, GB-1, Improved Lalat, MTU 1010, MTU 1001, Naveen, Swarna Shreya which can be grown during dry season. Seed rate for an acre of land is 20 kg for these varieties. Treat the seeds with Carbendazim 50% W.P @ 2-gram/1-kg of seeds or Carboxin 37.5% + Thiram 37.5% @ 3-gram/1 kg of seeds before sowing in the nursery.

Apply half dose of Urea + half dose of MOP as 2nd top dressing at second irrigation. Need-based spray of Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 50g/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60 ml/acre mixed with 200 ltrs of water is recommended. Spray 0.2% wettable sulphur @ 2g/ltr of water for powdery mildew.

Select YMV disease resistant varieties like PDM 139, PDM 11. To prevent whitefly infestation seeds should be treated with Imidacloprid @ 7-gram/kg of seeds before sowing. Install yellow sticky traps starting from 2-3 leaf stage of the crop. Diseased plants should be rogued out to prevent further spread of the disease.

There are chances of Aphid infestation in early sown mustard crop. To manage aphids at early stage, put yellow sticky traps per acre. Spray Neem based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. If the infestation is severe than spray chemical pesticide Thiamethoxam @ 40-gram/acre or Acetamiprid @ 50-gram/acre in 200-liter of water.

To manage aphids, and thrips spray Neem Based Pesticide 300 PPM @ 1-litre/acre during primary stage of infestation. If the infestation is severe than spray Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 40-gram/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 50-ml/acre by mixing it in 200 liter of water. Apply pre-emergence herbicide Oxyfluorfen 23.5 % EC @ 80ml/acre or Pendimethalin 30 % EC @ 1-litre/acre or at 1-2 DAS.

Harvest the red gram crop when 70-80% Pods turn brown. Over maturity can cause shattering of seeds which results in lower yield. Harvested plants should be kept in threshing floor for sun drying for 3-6 days depending on season. After that threshing should be done by beating the pods with a stick. Clean harvested seeds should be dried under direct sunlight to bring the moisture content below 10-12% for safe storage. Dal processing should be done in composite mini dal mill.

To control aphids and thrips in chilli during the primary stage of pest infestation spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 40 g/acre or Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 50 g/acre or Profenophos 40% + Fenpyroximate 2.5% EC @ 400-ml/acre.

Apply borax as soil application during transplanting in Cole crops to prevent Brown rot. If Borax was not applied during transplanting of seedlings than spray Borax. Spraying of Boron micronutrient should be done after two weeks of transplanting and two weeks before curd formation.

There are chances of infestation of Dimond Back Moth in early planted Cole crops. To manage this pest, install light traps per acre. During the primary stage of pest infestation spray neem-based pesticide @ 1-litre/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water.

To manage whitefly in Brinjal and Tomato crop, use yellow sticky traps per acre to attract and kill the insects. During the primary stage of pest infestation spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water.

To control fruit borer in Tomato, first collect and destroy the affected fruits and grown-up larvae. Set up pheromone traps per acre. Go for spraying of insecticide if there are 10% fruits infested with the borer.
To prevent Damping off disease in the nursery, drench the nursery bed with Carbendazim @ 2 g/litre of water at 15 days interval. Seedlings of 8-weeks old are planted in the main field.

Early planted potato crop is at 3-week stage. Go for hoeing and weeding and apply the rest 30-45 Kg N/acre. For better tuber growth in potato, soil temperature below 30Â°C should be maintained. Therefore farmers are advised to irrigate the field. There are chances of Leaf Blight disease incidence in potato crop. To manage early leaf blight in potato, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @600 gram/acre or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% W.P @ 400-gram/acre. To manage late blight in potato spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% W.P @ 40 =gram/acre at 10 days interval.
